text: A randomisation list, stratified by centre, with a fixed block size of 10, was generated using a computer-based method by an independent epidemiologist at the Clinical Epidemiology and Public Health Research Unit of the IRCCS Burlo Garofolo, Trieste, Italy. Allocation concealment was guaranteed by the use of sealed, opaque envelopes, consecutively numbered, each containing the allocation group. After obtaining informed consent, the healthcare staff performing the needle procedures opened the envelope marked with lowest number available and assigned the patient to the corresponding group.
